definition: Peking ape-man/Homo erectus pekinensis (c. 600,000 BC), discovered in Zhoukoudian 周口店[Zhou1 kou3 dian4] in 1921

sentences.english: The fossil (skull) of "Peking Man" (LPP) discovered in Zhoukoudian, Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 北京猿人头骨化石在周口店发现。

sentences.english: The ape apes the ape-man in everything he does.
sentences.chinese: 大猩猩一切都模仿猿人。

sentences.english: And a provocative exhibition tries to unpick the myth about the world's most famous apeman .
sentences.chinese: 法国引人入胜的展览欲揭开世界上最有名的猿人之谜。

sentences.english: Wolpoff of the University of Michigan at Ann Arbor wonders whether the Flores find might even represent an offshoot of Australopithecus.
sentences.chinese: 则琢磨弗洛瑞斯岛人骨甚至可能代表南猿人的一支。

sentences.english: So far a total of more than 40 individual fossils of ape-man .
sentences.chinese: 至今共发现40个以上个体的猿人化石。

sentences.english: Lisa really enjoyed visiting Peking Man's home.
sentences.chinese: 莉萨真的很喜欢参观北京猿人的遗址。

sentences.english: In the1920s, archaeologists discovered the complete skull of Peking Man.
sentences.chinese: 考古学家发现了一块完整的北京猿人颅骨，口译。

sentences.english: To about 20 million years ago, Peking Man was away from here.
sentences.chinese: 到约20万年前，北京猿人才离此而去。

sentences.english: Peking Man lived in a cave.
Homo erectus is a progenitor of Homo sapiens.
sentences.chinese: 直立猿人是真人的祖先。

sentences.english: Findings indicate that Peking Man had discovered how to make fires.
sentences.chinese: 出土的一些文物表明北京猿人已发现了如何生火。

sentences.english: Bob remembers when humans were a tribe of monkeys, in Africa.
sentences.chinese: 鲍勃记起了人类还是猿人时的情景。

sentences.english: Peking Man lived 690000 years ago, during Paleolithic times.
sentences.chinese: 北京猿人生活在六十九万年前的旧石器时代。

definition: berserker (Norse warrior or fantasy role-playing character)
